alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 18 at 1:10AM PDT until July 21 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated, long period surf of 3 to 6 feet. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches, especially south facing beaches. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very strong rip currents and long-shore currents are expected along many beaches due to a long period south swell.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
